summary: This is an internal FBI email from a Public Affairs Specialist in the New York office, dated October 30, 2019. It notes that media calls are being received regarding a Fox News story featuring a forensic pathologist's interview about Jeffrey Epstein's death, and states that both the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) are declining to comment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The subject of the Fox News story and interview regarding the manner of his death (homicide vs. suicide).

events.title: Fox News airs interview on Epstein death
events.description: Fox News airs a story/interview with a forensic pathologist discussing Jeffrey Epstein's death as a potential homicide rather than suicide.

keyFacts: On October 30, 2019, the FBI New York office was receiving media calls about a Fox News story regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The Fox News story featured an interview with a forensic pathologist who suggested Epstein's death may have been a homicide, not a suicide.
Both the FBI's New York office and the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) were declining to comment on the story at that time.
